reference_summary:
Way We Were, The
Drama, Passionate, Sad, Sentimental
['Set during the politically charged time of pre-WWII McCarthyism, a young couple with diametrically opposing views of politics, friendships and careers find it difficult to balance their private love and desires with their very public lives.']
{'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Pollack', 'Sydney'], 'Producers': ['Ray Stark'], 'Starring': ['Barbra Streisand', 'Robert Redford', 'Bradford Dillman']}
Most movies have happy endings. The ending is not horible but its not a good one. I wish the main character would had fought for his wife, specialy because it is because of her that he got to the top! Never even notice him being depress or ask for a second opportunity or do anything to save the marriage. It broke my heart!
Upset! No happy ending to an amazong movie!
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Radha Bharadwaj'], 'Producers': ['Radha Bharadwaj', 'Gregory Cascante', 'Mike Cline', 'Christian Slater'], 'Starring': ['Jared Leto', 'Christian Slater', 'Claire Forlani'], 'Studio': ['Multicom Entertainment Group (MEG)']}
The only reason why i gave this movie a 4 n not a  5 star is because basil didnt mary clara at the end.
Amazing movie.
The Song
Drama, Romance, Inspiring, Mystical
['An aspiring singer-songwriter is struggling to catch a break and escape the long shadow of his famous father until he writes a love song that catapults him to stardom.']
{'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Richard Ramsey'], 'Producers': ['Shane Sooter', 'Cassandra Pelan'], 'Starring': ['Ali Faulkner', 'Alan Powell', 'Caitlin Nicol-Thomas']}
I love the lessons this movie teaches! Most humans are just worried about providing, they forget to protect the most important things Love (God) and family!!!!!!
Sooo worth it!
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['John Korty'], 'Producers': ['David V. Picker'], 'Starring': ["Ryan O'Neal", 'Candice Bergen', 'Nicola Pagett'], 'Studio': ['Paramount']}
Not enough plot. Is nice to see that oliver at the end realise that he needs to live a living life againg, but theres not a true happy ending of maybe him remarrying n living happely ever after.
Its ok
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

The user exhibits a strong inclination towards emotional and dramatic narratives, particularly those that dive into intricate relationships and societal issues with historical context. Their recent interaction reflects a critical perspective, as they express disappointment in narratives lacking depth, emphasizing their need for richer plots and satisfying resolutions. While the user appreciates themes of personal growth and the importance of love and family, they also demonstrate a discerning taste for stories that deliver a true sense of closure, highlighting their robust engagement with character arcs.

This user's preference for uplifting themes continues to be a cornerstone of their profile, yet their latest review reveals a nuanced expectation for content that not only inspires but also provides coherent and fulfilling endings. They seek stories that resonate emotionally but also challenge them with complexity, ensuring that their experiences in narrative consumption align with their values for introspection and real-life struggles.

Overall, the user's tastes reflect a balance between sentimentality and critical engagement, with a focus on narratives that offer not just emotional resonance but also substantial plot development and moral lessons. Their ongoing search for profound storytelling underscores a desire for narratives that address both human connection and societal dynamics, affirming their role as a thoughtful and discerning audience member.
